metadata.title: CVE-2019-13627 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
It was discovered that there was a ECDSA timing attack in the libgcrypt20cryptographic library. Version affected: 1.8.4-5, 1.7.6-2+deb9u3, and1.6.3-2+deb8u4. Versions fixed: 1.8.5-2 and 1.6.3-2+deb8u7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13627` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt11 - 1.5.3-2ubuntu4.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libgcrypt11 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.3-2ubuntu4.6+esm1').
